Notifications & Commands

This screen will hold the latest 200 notifications, alerts, commands and command results.

You can filter the list and optionally informational and alert system notifications to only show for the currently selected vehicle.

Touch a notification to show it in a dialog, do a long touch to copy it to the clipboard. Touching a command history entry loads the command into the input box so you can simply change and/or resubmit it.

You may send text (SMS) commands, MMI (USSD) commands, MSG commands and modem (AT) commands. All commands issued from here are sent via TCP/IP connection, so SMS commands and their results will not be charged as SMS messages.

Examples:

 • SMS: STAT — get vehicle status
 • MMI: *100# — normally SIM account balance
 • MSG: #31 — historical data summary
 • Modem: @AT… — see modem command manual

Notes: MMI commands depend on the GSM carrier / SIM provider, check your provider's documentation if available. Modem commands do not return their results. See OVMS protocol documentation for standard MSG commands.

Battery history Options Get data Reset zoom Info Show Volt Show Temp Loading data… Requesting battery status… Retrieving pack data… Retrieving cell data… Pack history Cell status SOC (%) Volt (V) Volt min (V) Temp (°C)

Battery history

Basics

The firmware version needs to support the battery monitor feature. The charts are based on the record types RT-BAT-P and RT-BAT-C (see Manual). The server will keep these for 24h.

The measurement resolution is 5 mV on voltage and 1 °C on temperature. The Twizy battery pack consists of 42 cells with layout 14S3P, distributed to 7 modules. The system supports only distinct measurements of the 14 3P bundle voltages and the 7 module temperatures.

Packet history

The packet chart only displays times with data, so excludes inactive parking times.

The module sends updates to the server every ~60 seconds during driving or charging (while network/server connection is available). Extremes and max standard deviations are collected continuously, current values are those at the time of the update sent.

On switch on of the Twizy and start of charging, the collected values are reset, so at the end of a usage section these show the overall extremes that occurred during a usage section.

Hint: to follow the minimum voltage line, click on it to highlight an entry, then use the seek bar to move the marker.

Cell status

 • lower end = minimum value
 • upper end = current value (+text)
 • filled box = bad
 • bigger box = more deviation

It\'s a candle stick chart. The maximum value shown is the current value (volt_act / temp_act), the minimum value is the smallest value measured (volt_min / temp_min) within the current usage section.

The candle height reflects the maximum deviation measured. A filled candle is used to display a "bad" deviation, i.e. higher voltage breakdown or higher temperature rise.

Hint: to compare voltage details, select a cell and zoom in vertically until you can clearly read the deviations of the other cells from the selection marker.

12V History 12V Battery History Retrieving 12V data… Voltage (V) Reference (V) Current (A) Ambient temp (°C) Charger temp (°C)

12V Battery History

As lead-acid car batteries tend to die without warning (especially during winter) and need to handle an additional unplanned constant load from the OVMS, the module includes a 12V monitoring and alert system.

Note: The 12V voltage is measured using the incoming voltage that powers the OVMS. As the sensor used by the module has some manufacturing tolerances you should do an initial calibration. See the user manual for details.

History Data

The 12V data is kept by the server for 24 hours. The local copy of the App is not updated automatically, use the update button to retrieve the last 24 hours.

The history chart shows the actual 12V battery voltage, the reference voltage (see below), the 12V current, and the ambient and charger temperatures. Not all vehicles can provide all of this. The menu has options to show only voltages or temperatures, the current is always shown.

Sections of 12V charging and vehicle usages are shown by vertical dashed lines. Click on any data point to set the focus and display a cross hair for comparison. Pinch to zoom and move the chart as usual, and reset the view by the menu option.

Most vehicles trickle charge the 12V battery from the main battery when idle by the internal DC/DC converter which is normally built into the charger. If you don\'t see a regular charging pattern, your DC converter may be defective.

Reference & Alerts

The reference voltage is updated 15 minutes after the 12V charging stops. It\'s used as the alert reference if it\'s higher than the configured default reference of a healthy battery.

If the actual voltage drops below the reference by the configured threshold, the OVMS will automatically send an alert. This is handled by the module, the App doesn\'t need to run for this.

A higher charge voltage during winter is normal and expected, as lead-acid batteries need higher charge voltages at lower temperatures.

Tips

A healthy lead-acid battery will not drop below 11.8V without load.

If you see continuous or fast degradation of the voltages or unusually high currents and/or charger temperatures, that\'s a sign of a dying battery.

Regularly check your battery for signs of gasing (i.e. bloating), if present disconnect the battery ASAP. Also look for corrosion on the terminals.

To enhance the life span of a lead-acid battery, take care to regularly do a full charge (i.e. keep the 12V charger running until finished). This normally takes 3-4 hours and is especially important in cold climates or winter.

If you\'re going to park your car for some time, unplug the OVMS.

Power history Options Get data Reset zoom Last 5 %1$s Last 10 %1$s Info Show energy Show power Loading… Retrieving GPS log… Trip Altitude (m) Speed (%1$s) Power (W) Min Max Avg (W) Recup Limit Drive Limit Energy Used (Wh) Recovered (Wh) Avg (Wh/%1$s)

Power history

Basics

The charts are based on the RT-GPS-Log records (see manual). The server will keep these for 24h.

The GPS log is updated once per minute by default. This can be raised to every 5 seconds by setting the streaming mode (feature #8) to 2.

The altitude measurement depends on the GPS signal. The other measurements do not depend on GPS.

Note: power and energy measurements are an interpretation of undocumented CAN bus data, that may be incorrect and/or incomplete (see manual).

Trip

The chart displays the altitude (GPS) and the average speed of the trip. Inclines and high speeds result in high energy usage.

The vertical marker lines show the beginnings of usage sections (driving / charging) along with their respective odometer values.

Power

The filled area displays the maximum and minimum electrical power (at the battery) per time section, negative power = recuperation/charging. The upper & lower light red lines show the battery limits.

The red line shows the average power derived from the energy usage of the time section.

Info: the mechanical motor power calculates as electrical power x efficiency(controller+motor). Combined efficiency is around ~75% to 95% depending on the current load situation, ~90% on average.

Energy usage

The filled area displays the maximum and minimum energy usage/gain (at the battery) per time section, negative usage = recuperation/charging.

The yellow line shows the effective energy consumption per km/Mi derived from the total energy usage and the distance driven. This is the higher, the more energy is used and the less distance has been driven on a time section.

Info: total usable capacity of the battery is around 6100 Wh. On charging, the energy stored calculates as energy delivered x efficiency(charger+battery). Combined charging efficiency will normally be ~92%.

Service: Enable background connection Allows the server connection to stay alive when the App is not running. Broadcast: Enable data broadcasts to other Apps (e.g. Notification) Enter code letters Notification: Enable notifications for Developer App Version Commands: Enable vehicle command service API key: Revoke & Renew Really revoke & renew the API key, invalidating all pinned commands? Plugin Firmware Firmware Update Date DD/MM/YYYY"> activate plugin and firmware option at Homelink menu Enable Firmware Update Disable Firmware Update Enable Plugin Menu Disable Plugin Menu smartEQ OVMS install smartEQ Repo deinstall smartEQ Repo, need reboot! update Plugins script reload Firmware install! Be careful! The Module needed 5 to 10 min. to install! update Firmware!!! Enable xsq disable option Disable xsq -> standard metrics Enable scheduled booster Disable scheduled booster Enable GPS on/off at Parking Disable GPS on/off at Parking Enable check and Charge 12V Disable check and Charge 12V Enable modem LTE check Disable modem LTE check Enable auxbatmon Disable auxbatmon Enable pwrmon Disable pwrmon Enable regenmon Disable regenmon Enable repidscan Disable repidscan Enable retools Disable retools

Update broadcasting allows to send car data updates to other Apps like Automagic or Tasker for the message codes given.

Developer versions that do not have the appropriate signature or Firebase key do not receive status messages. This workaround is necessary for this.

The command service allows Apps to issue vehicle commands and receive command results. To issue commands, the sending App needs to know the vehicle ID and password or the API key. Note: all Apps will receive all command results.

Install OVMS/smartEQ plugin via app via Homelink menu, many of these plugins also work with other vehicles. Please read the OVMS plugins and smartEQ plugins for details.

Install firmware via app via Homelink menu

The API key is your local command authorization allowing commands independent of the currently selected vehicle. Renewing the API key will invalidate all installed or pinned command shortcuts. Use this to revoke all stored command authorizations in other Apps at once.

See OVMS Android Wiki and OVMS protocol (PDF) for message details.

Stored Commands Add Command Edit Command Do you want to add an icon for this command to your home screen? Title/name Command OVMS Service running OVMS Service started SOC and range, battery temperature and charge time This App uses Google Play Services for push notifications and maps integration. It will run without, but you might consider installing the Play Services package. Remind Don\'t remind Permissions required \ · Permission to post notifications is required to enable push notification alerts and infos, e.g. on charge interruption or theft detection.\n\ · Permission to access the fine location is required by Android to allow the map\'s \"home\" button (which actually takes the map back to the vehicle position). Later Version %1$s (%2$d)

About OVMS:

Open Vehicles Monitoring System is a community project enabling remote monitoring and control of vehicles with Open Source software and hardware.

· OpenVehicles.com

· User guide (OVMS v3)

· GitHub

· Privacy policy

 

Main changes since last release:

· Add VW e-Up charger settings (firmware 3.3.004)

· General fixes & optimizations

Please read the version history for details on all changes.

Hint: there is also some useful info in the Wiki.

Have fun!

Open Vehicle Monitoring System About OVMS
